page.title: 05Dairy Farming
page.content: Dairy farming,though not a major form of farming is very important in this area particularly:on the Weald Moors at Preston,on Kynnesley Moor,Sleap Moor and Crudgington Moor.In some cases attempts have been made to turn this land to arable use,but it seems to be too difficult to drain adequately. Fresian cattle are used for milk production,they spend most of the summer months grazing in the fields but large amounts of silage(grass cut when green and placed in heaps called clamps)are made for winter feed. Milk is collected daily by MMB bulk tankers and taken to Crudgington Creamery. Farms in the area are on average 200-450 acres in size. Some Hereford,Hereford Cross and Charlois cattle are reared for beef.
